info.title: Vlocity Configure, Price, Quote Web APIs v2 Documentation - BETA
info.description: Vlocity Configure, Price, Quote Web APIs (CPQ APIs) enable client application users to shop for and order products and services. The CPQ APIs provide a layer of abstraction between the client app developers and the CPQ developers who are configuring and customizing the underlying CPQ logic.Version two of the CPQ APIs simplifies the APIs for mobile and external app development. The v2 APIs are the default APIs used by  Vlocity applications. Base URL for the apis described is 'xx##.salesforce.com/services/apexrest/vlocity_cmt/v2'.

cartId.name: cartid
cartId.description: Cart Id (Salesforce Id). Opportunity, Quote or Order Id. - Required

fields.name: fields
fields.description: List of fields to return in the response, separated by commas.

price.name: price
price.description: specifies the fields to be sorted

itemId.name: itemId
itemId.description: Line Item Id under the cart- Required

productHierarchyPath.name: productHierarchyPath
productHierarchyPath.description: Product hierarchy path of the item getting expanded

pagesize.name: pagesize
pagesize.description: Number of records to be returned

commitmentDateFilter.name: commitmentDateFilter
commitmentDateFilter.description: Filters active applied promotions based on this date

appliedPromoStatusFilter.name: appliedPromoStatusFilter
appliedPromoStatusFilter.description: Filter to specific the kind of applied promotions to be retrieved.

maxProdListHierarchy.name: maxProdListHierarchy
maxProdListHierarchy.description: hierarchy depth returned for list of products

lastRecordId.name: lastRecordId
lastRecordId.description: The last record ID from the previous search result, if available

includeIneligible.name: includeIneligible
includeIneligible.description: Whether to include ineligible products or not

category.name: category
category.description: Category to which the product belongs

offsetSize.name: offsetSize
offsetSize.description: Offset from which to start reading products, for pagination.

post.description:
Creates an opportunity, order, or quote based on the subaction specified in the request body. Subaction also defines method of creation. Subactions supported include...

  **createOrder** - Create an empty order from the specified inputs. 
    
  **createQuote** - Create an empty quote from the specified inputs. 
    
  **createOppty** - Create an empty opportunity from the specified inputs. 
    
  **assetToOrder** - Create a change order initially populated from the specified assets.
    
  **assetToQuote** - Create a quote for changes initially populated from the specified assets. (Not yet implemented)
    
  **assetChangeSite** - Create a change order to request moving the specified assets from one service location to another. (Not yet implemented)
  
  **Please note these subactions cover the Create Cart and the Change Asset to Order APIs in the Developer Documentation.** 
  
  ** Rest Handler - CpqCreateCartActionV2. Method Invoked - postCartItems.**

parameters.name: requestBody
parameters.description:
Different request bodies must be used for each of the different subactions - Required.

### createOrder Request Example
```json
{
    "subaction":"createOrder",
    "inputFields":[
      {  "effectivedate":"2017-12-25"  },
      {  "status":"Draft"  },
      {  "Name":"New customer order"  },
      {  "AccountId":"0016A0000053kHN"  },
     {  "Pricebook2Id":"01s6A000002Y7wz"  },
      {  "vlocity_cmt__OriginatingChannel__c":"Retail"  }
    ],
    "fields":"Id,Name,EffectiveDate,AccountId,Account.Name,vlocity_cmt__EffectiveRecurringTotal__c,vlocity_cmt__EffectiveOneTimeTotal__c,vlocity_cmt__EffectiveOrderTotal__c,TotalAmount,vlocity_cmt__OriginatingChannel__c,OrderNumber,OrderReferenceNumber,Pricebook2Id"
}
```

### createQuote Request Example
```json
{
    "subaction":"createQuote",
    "inputFields":[
      {  "AccountId":"0016A0000053kHN"  },
      {  "OpportunityId":"0066A000002aVklQAE"  },
      {  "status":"Draft"  },
      {  "Name":"New customer quote"  },
      {  "Pricebook2Id":"01s6A000002Y7wz"  },
      {  "vlocity_cmt__OriginatingChannel__c":"Retail"  }
    ],
    "fields":"Id,QuoteNumber,Name,OpportunityId,Status,AccountId,Account.Name,vlocity_cmt__EffectiveRecurringTotal__c,vlocity_cmt__EffectiveOneTimeTotal__c,vlocity_cmt__EffectiveQuoteTotal__c,GrandTotal,vlocity_cmt__OriginatingChannel__c"
}
```

### createOppty Request Example
```json
{
    "subaction":"createOppty",
    "inputFields":[
      {  "AccountId":"0016A0000053kHN"  },
      {  "StageName":"Prospecting"  },
      {  "Name":"New customer opportunity"  },
      {  "Type":"New Customer"  },
      {  "CloseDate":"2017-12-25"  },
      {  "vlocity_cmt__NumberOfContractedMonths__c":24  },
      {  "Pricebook2Id":"01s6A000002Y7wz"  },
      {  "vlocity_cmt__OriginatingChannel__c":"Dealer"  }
    ],
    "fields":"Id,Name,AccountId,Account.Name,vlocity_cmt__EffectiveRecurringTotal__c,vlocity_cmt__EffectiveOneTimeTotal__c,vlocity_cmt__EffectiveOpportunityTotal__c,Amount,vlocity_cmt__OriginatingChannel__c"
}
```

### assetToOrder Request Example
```json
{
  "subaction":"assetToOrder",
  "assetIdList":[
    "01t36000000pfcKAAQ",
    "02i6A000000YEXN"
  ],
  "accountId":"0016A0000072D3y",
  "RequestDate":"2017-12-01"
}
```

200.description: OK - API request processed. Look for messages in the response to determine if it succeeded or failed.

400.description: Bad Request - Invalid subaction or Invalid Parameters

get.description: Returns a summary representation of the cart including: + Pricing information, such as total one-time charge and total recurring charge  + Account information associated with this cart + If this cart includes a multisite order, available sites + Links to further actions, such as *check out* Rest Handler - CpqCreateCartActionV2 Method Invoked - getCarts

parameters.name: headerFieldSet
parameters.description:
Name of a Salesforce Field Set defined for the given cart object (Opportunity, Quote, Order) which identifies the fields to return in the response.
Omitting this parameter will return all fields from the cart object except the following fields: IsDeleted, CreatedDate, CreatedById, LastModifiedDate, LastModifiedById, SystemModstamp, LastActivityDate, CleanStatus.

parameters.name: translation
parameters.description: to get translated labels, default is true (CMT 101)

200.description: OK - API request processed. Look for messages in the response to determine if it succeeded or failed.


get.summary: Get Applied or Available Promotions for a Cart
get.description:
Promotions give a cart beneficial pricing or other benefits. A given cart for a given customer will only have  certain promotions available to be applied to the cart. A cart can also already have one or more promotions  applied. This GET operation will retrieve any promotions applied or available to the given cart.

**Sub Action** - By default (when *subaction=...* is omitted from the request) this operation returns the list of promotions that are available to be applied to the given cart. Add the *subaction=getPromotionsAppliedToCart*  query parameter to instead request the list of promotions that are currently applied to the cart.

 * **subaction=getPromotionsAppliedToCart** - Return promotions currently applied to the cart
 * **subaction parameter omitted** - Return promotions that are available to be applied to the cart

**includes** - By default the qualifications for each promotion are not returned in the response because  they take time to calculate. Add the *includes=qualifications* query parameter to request a  list of required qualifications for each promotion and which are satisfied or not satisfied. If the *includes=*  parameter is omitted, the *category* fields and *qualifications* arrays will not be returned in the response.

 Rest Handler - APIPromotionsCartsCpqV2 Method Invoked - getCartsPromotions

parameters.name: subaction
parameters.description: An optional subaction that switches what data is returned from the request.

parameters.name: includes
parameters.description: Optional components to include in the response. Currently only *qualifications*.

parameters.name: includePenalties
parameters.description: whether to return the penalties for the promotions in the result or not

parameters.name: ruleType
parameters.description: Indicates which type of context rule to run. This should be used when we have includes param as qualifications or evaluation

parameters.name: ruleEvaluationInput
parameters.description: The input to be used in the evaluation of context rules

delete.description: This API delete applied promotions items from cart Rest Handler - APIPromotionsCartsCpqV2 Method Invoked - deletePromotionItems
delete.summary: Delete of Promotion Items in Cart.

parameters.name: id
parameters.description: Applied promotion item Id

parameters.name: requestBody
parameters.description:
Request Body with input fields

 ###  Delete Promotion Items in Cart Request Example

 ```json
   {
     "id": "a2Lf40000008nL5EAI",
     "cartId": "801f40000012NEIAA2",
     "methodName": "deleteAppliedPromoItems",
     "price": true,
     "validate": true
   }
```

get.summary: Get Applied Promotions for a Customer Account
get.description:
Customers can have one or more active promotions applied which give them beneficial pricing or other benefits.  This GET operation will retrieve any promotions applied to the given customer's assets, contracts or the account itself.

**includes** - By default the qualifications for each applied promotion are not returned in the response because  they take time to calculate. Add the *includes=qualifications* query parameter to request a  list of required qualifications and which are satisfied or not satisfied. If the *includes=*  parameter is omitted, the *category* field and *qualifications* array will not be returned in the response.
**Filters** - By default all of the applied promotions are returned in the response. The *filters* parameter allows  returning a subset.

 Rest Handler - APIAppliedPromotionsAccountsV2 Method Invoked - getAppliedPromotionsByAccount

parameters.name: includes
parameters.description: Optional components to include in the response. Currently only *qualifications*.

parameters.name: ruleType
parameters.description: Indicates which type of context rule to run. This should be used when we have includes param as qualifications or evaluation

parameters.name: ruleEvaluationInput
parameters.description: The input to be used in the evaluation of context rules

get.description: Get list of products available to be added to the cart based on the given criteria.  Rest Handler - APIProductsCartsCpqV2 Method Invoked - getCartsProducts

parameters.name: attributes
parameters.description: Attribute filters. For example, for the attribute memory (attributecode=attr1) with selected values 16gb and 32gb and attribute color (attr2) with red selected, the format will be as shown in the example.

parameters.name: includeAttributes
parameters.description: Specifies whether to return a list of attributes and their values for the product.

parameters.description: Search text

parameters.name: id

get.description: Get pricelists avaialble to a cart Id. Rest Handler CpqGetPriceListsActionV2 Method Invoked getPricelists
get.summary: Get Pricelists Available to a Cart

get.description: Get Carts Line Item Prices Rest Handler - APIPriceCartsCpqV2 Method Invoked -
get.summary: Returns Flat List of Field Values Without Executing Pricing.

parameters.name: priceDetailsFields
parameters.description: Comma separated list of fields to retrieve price values for

200.description: cart items

get.description: This API retrieves next level of children under a particular product in a bundle (in cart) Rest Handler - APIExpandItemCartsCpqv2 Method Invoked - getExpandedItems
get.summary: Expand Parent Item To Display Next Level Children.

put.description: This API runs the product configuration rules on the updated attribute in the cart. Any changes done as an impact of product configuration rules are returned back as response of this API. Rest Handler - APIItemAttributesItemsCartsCpqV2 Method Invoked - putItemAttributes

parameters.name: price
parameters.description: pricing evaluation

parameters.name: requestBody
parameters.description:
Request Body with input fields - Required

 ###  Update Item Attributes request example

 ```json

  {
    "fields":null,
    
    "items":{JSONRECORD},
    
    "itemId":"8021I000001kvWeQAI",
    
    "cartId":"8011I000000TOcSQAW",
    
    "methodName":"putItemAttributes",
    
    "price":true,"validate":true
    
    }
 ```

post.description: Clones line items in the cart.
post.summary: Clones line items in the cart.

parameters.name: requestBody
parameters.description:
Request Body with input fields - Required

 ###  Clone line item request example

 ```json

 {

  "methodName": "cloneItems",
  
  "cartId": "801360000008eNU",
  
  "items":[ {"itemId":"01t36000000pfcKAAQ"}]
  
  }
 ```

parameters.name: requestBody
parameters.description:
Request Body with input fields - Required

 ###  Checkout request example

 ```json
 {
   methodName:"checkout"

   cartId:801360000008eNU

  ContextId:801360000008eNU

 }
 ```

200.description: Checkout items in the cart.

get.description: Retrieves time plans, time policies, and adjustment codes. The Price Adjustment dialog box enables a user to pick a time plan and time policy to associate with a recurring adjustment or to pick a code that defines an adjustment for a specific price, such as a recurring charge, one-time charge, one-time total, and so on. Rets Handler - listOfValues Method Invoked - getListsOfValues

parameters.name: listkeys
parameters.description: The type of lists for which to retrieve values

parameters.name: fields
parameters.description: List of fields for which to retrieve adjustment codes

parameters.name: cartId
parameters.description: Opportunity, quote, or order ID to use as context ID

parameters.name: ID
parameters.description: Line item ID

parameters.name: PricingVariableCode
parameters.description: Pricing variable code associated with the price field

200.description:
### Response for  get list of values

```json
                {
      
         "totalSize": 1,
      
         "messages": [],
      
         "records": [
      
            {
      
      "messages": [],
      
               "displaySequence": -1,
      
               "id": "80246000000gZfOAAU",
      
               "vlocity_cmt__OneTimeCharge__c": {

                     {

                        "EndValue": 50,
```

get.description: Return the entire catalog and its products. Rest Handler - APICatalogsCpqV2 Method Invoked - getCatalogHierarchy

parameters.name: catalogID
parameters.description: Line item ID

CartPromotion.description: Representation of an available or applied promotion.

displaySequence.description: Sequence to display in the UI.

Name.description: (Available promotions only) Name of the promotion.

vlocity_cmt__Code__c.description: (Available promotions only) Code the identifies the given promotion.

vlocity_cmt__Description__c.description: (Available promotions only) Description of the promotion.

Id.description: (Available promotions only) Id of the promotion (Salesforce Id).

category.description: Qualification Category - Whether the promotion is *qualified* or *disqualified* for this cart.

allOf.description: (Applied promotions only) Sequence in which this promotion is applied to the cart.
(Applied promotions only) Id of the promotion.

AppliedPromotion.description: Representation of an applied promotion which is applied to an account, contract or asset(s).

category.description: Qualification Category - Whether the applied promotion is now *qualified* or *disqualified* for the current state of the customer account.

Qualification.description: Representation of a qualification required for the object it describes and whether it passes or fails for that object.

type.description: Type of qualification such as rule set, rule or rule condition.

qualifies.description: Whether this qualification is satisfied or not.

failureMessage.description: If not satisfied, a message explaining why not.

totalSize.description: Number of records in the records array.
Number of records in the records array.

subaction.description: Type of cart to create and method to use to create it.

fields.description: List of fields to return in the response, separated by commas.

CreateOrderBody.description: A representation to create a new order.

inputFields.description: An array of objects each defining a field and input value. Fields must be valid field API names for the Salesforce Order object [as defined here](https://developer.salesforce.com/docs/atlas.en-us.api.meta/api/sforce_api_objects_order.htm) or Vlocity field extensions or fields from related objects using relationship names such as Account.Name [see Understanding Relationship Names](https://developer.salesforce.com/docs/atlas.en-us.soql_sosl.meta/soql_sosl/sforce_api_calls_soql_relationships_understanding.htm)                for more information.

CreateQuoteBody.description: A representation to create a new quote.

inputFields.description: An array of objects each defining a field and input value. Fields must be valid field API names for the Salesforce Quote object [as defined here](https://developer.salesforce.com/docs/atlas.en-us.api.meta/api/sforce_api_objects_quote.htm) or Vlocity field extensions or fields from related objects using relationship names such as Account.Name [see Understanding Relationship Names](https://developer.salesforce.com/docs/atlas.en-us.soql_sosl.meta/soql_sosl/sforce_api_calls_soql_relationships_understanding.htm)                for more information.
